sen.j: ウヒヂニ・スヒヂニは、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)である。
sen.e: Uhijini and Suhijini are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).
Uhijini and Suhijini are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).
Uhijini and Suhijini are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).

sen.j: 神世七代の第3代の神で、ウヒヂニが男神、スヒヂニが女神である。
sen.e: Uhijini and Suhijini are the 3rd generations among the Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Uhijini is a god and Suhijini is a goddess.
Uhijini and Suhijini are the 3rd generation among the Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Uhijini is a god and Suhijini is a goddess.
Uhijini and Suhijini are the 3rd generation among the Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Uhijini is a god and Suhijini is a goddess.

sen.j: それまでは独神であったが、この代ではじめて男女一対の神となった。
sen.e: There has been only one god for a generation, and this generation is the first to have a pair of a god and a goddess.
There had been only one god per generation, and this generation is the first to have a pair of a god and a goddess.
There had been only one god per generation, and this generation is the first to have a pair of a god and a goddess.

sen.j: 神名の「ウ」は泥（古語で「うき」）、「ス」は沙（砂）の意味である。
sen.e: U' in the name of Uhijini means mud (or 'uki,' in the ancient Japanese language), amd 'su' in the name of Suhijini means sand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: U' in the name of Uhijini means mud (or 'uki,' in the ancient Japanese language), amd 'su' in the name of Suhijini means sand.
U' in the name of Uhijini means mud (or 'uki,' in the ancient Japanese language), and 'su' in the name of Suhijini means sand.

sen.j: 大地が泥や沙によってやや形を表した様子を表現したものである。
sen.e: Their names imply how the earth has been shaped by mud and sand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Their names imply how the earth has been shaped by mud and sand.
Their names imply how the earth has been shaped by mud and sand.
